connector.description: Parse fixed width and delimited files using the FlatPack library.

camel.sink.path.type.name: camel.sink.path.type
camel.sink.path.type.description: Whether to use fixed or delimiter One of: [fixed] [delim]

camel.sink.path.resourceUri.name: camel.sink.path.resourceUri
camel.sink.path.resourceUri.description: URL for loading the flatpack mapping file from classpath or file system

camel.sink.endpoint.allowShortLines.name: camel.sink.endpoint.allowShortLines
camel.sink.endpoint.allowShortLines.description: Allows for lines to be shorter than expected and ignores the extra characters

camel.sink.endpoint.delimiter.name: camel.sink.endpoint.delimiter
camel.sink.endpoint.delimiter.description: The default character delimiter for delimited files.

camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreExtraColumns.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreExtraColumns
camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreExtraColumns.description: Allows for lines to be longer than expected and ignores the extra characters

camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreFirstRecord.name: camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreFirstRecord
camel.sink.endpoint.ignoreFirstRecord.description: Whether the first line is ignored for delimited files (for the column headers).

camel.sink.endpoint.splitRows.name: camel.sink.endpoint.splitRows
camel.sink.endpoint.splitRows.description: Sets the Component to send each row as a separate exchange once parsed

camel.sink.endpoint.textQualifier.name: camel.sink.endpoint.textQualifier
camel.sink.endpoint.textQualifier.description: The text qualifier for delimited files.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.name: camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding
camel.sink.endpoint.basicPropertyBinding.description: Whether the endpoint should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.component.flatpack.lazyStartProduc.name: camel.component.flatpack.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.flatpack.lazyStartProduc.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.flatpack.basicPropertyBi.name: camel.component.flatpack.basicPropertyBinding
camel.component.flatpack.basicPropertyBi.description: Whether the component should use basic property binding (Camel 2.x) or the newer property binding with additional capabilities
